activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 230, Branch 1

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodolfo Coronado Piedra

Case called @ 1:01 PM Defendant Rodolfo Coronado Piedra in court.  Attorney John H. Wallace III in court for Rodolfo Coronado Piedra.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Scott Schaut sworn in for testimony. Direct examination by DA Leusink. Witness identifies the Defendant in the courtroom. Cross examination by Atty Wallace. The Court finds probable cause exists. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG pleas entered as to all counts. STC scheduled - NOH given.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.

Case called @1:15 PM Defendant Rodolfo Coronado Piedra appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by video for Rodolfo Coronado Piedra. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant not eligible for SPD if released from custody. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $1,500 cash bond. DE will be privately retaining counsel. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
